ARH306Y1-F-20235.courseDescription: Intensive instruction in archaeological field methods and acquisition of field skills, including archaeological search and survey, site mapping, laying out excavation grids, use of theodolites, total station, and GPS, stratigraphic excavation, stratigraphy, field recording, screening sediment, Ontario license and reporting requirements. Normally this course would take place on campus in the summer. This course has a mandatory Lab Materials Fee of $25 to cover non-reusable materials. The fee will be included on the studentâ€™s ACORN invoice. The details and application form are posted on the following website: https://www.anthropology.utoronto.ca/undergraduate/curriculum-course-information/field-schools-and-research-opportunities. The application form should be submitted at least one week prior to the beginning of classes.
ARH306Y1-F-20235.prerequisite: ANT200Y1 or (NMC260H1 and NMC262H1) or NMC261Y0
ARH306Y1-F-20235.webTimetableInstructions: Information on this field course and the enrolment process can be found here: https://www.anthropology.utoronto.ca/undergraduate/curriculum-course-information/field-schools-and-research-opportunities

ARH495H1-F-20235.courseDescription: Laboratory or practical research on an archaeological project that emphasizes methods and research design in archaeology. Students must obtain the consent of a Supervisor before enrolling. Students are required to give an oral presentation of research results to an open meeting of the Archaeology Centre at the conclusion of the course. Application must be made to the Anthropology Department. Not eligible for CR/NCR option. Instructions on how to obtain an application form are posted on the following website: https://www.anthropology.utoronto.ca/undergraduate. The application form should be submitted at least one week prior to the beginning of classes.
ARH495H1-F-20235.prerequisite: A minimum of 14.0 credits, permission of Supervisor and Undergraduate Coordinator.
ARH495H1-F-20235.webTimetableInstructions: Instructions on how to obtain an application form are posted on the following website: https://www.anthropology.utoronto.ca/undergraduate Completed forms must be returned by May 1, 2023. Questions can be directed to Josie Alaimo at josie.alaimo@utoronto.ca.
